definition: to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: On the moonlit landscape, four or five people could be seen on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 在月光映照下，可以看到地面上有四，五个人。

sentences.english: Modular method is an effective method for solving extreme value problems of quasi—conformal mappings.
sentences.chinese: 模的方法是研究拟似共形映照极值问题的有效方法。

sentences.english: These were bayonets and gun-barrels confusedly illuminated by the distant reflection of the torch.
sentences.chinese: 那是被火炬的光映照着的远处的枪刺和枪管。

sentences.english: To reflect back her blushes and give sigh for sigh.
sentences.chinese: 映照她绯红的脸庞，和她一同叹息悲伤。

sentences.english: The clear water of Mid-Autumn Lake reflected your brilliant smiling face.
sentences.chinese: 秋中湖清澈的水面，映照出你灿烂的笑脸。

sentences.english: It means moonlight shining on water.
sentences.chinese: 这个词的意思是月光映照在水面上。

sentences.english: The Chinese flowering crabapple looks still even more charming against the green leaves.
sentences.chinese: 在绿叶的映照下，海棠花显得更加娇嫩艳丽。

sentences.english: In different time periods in the light reflectance changes, reflecting different angle.
sentences.chinese: 在不同的时间段里反射变动的光线，映照各异的角度。

sentences.english: The days were bright with snow, the nights forbiddingly dark.
sentences.chinese: 白天被积雪映照得异常明亮，夜晚又陷入难耐的漆黑。

sentences.english: Above the trees are the mountains, whose magnificence the river faithfully reflects on the surface.
sentences.chinese: 在树林的高处是山，其壮丽的景色完全映照在河面上。

sentences.english: Do you remember all the city lights on the water.
sentences.chinese: 你还记得万家灯火映照在水上的景象吗？

sentences.english: A stone in the sand in the setting sun could be very beautiful, they said.
sentences.chinese: 他们说，沙漠中的石头在夕阳映照下可能非常美丽。

sentences.english: Like a mirror, it reflected the social change of that time.
sentences.chinese: 它犹如一面镜子，映照出一个时代的风光云影。

definition: to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
(of a light source) to cast one's light on/to project (an image)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
gleaming reflection of waves in sunlight
to transmit/transmission (of radiation through a medium)/passage
to shine on/to light up/to irradiate
